longBusinessSummary: Rover Critical Minerals Corp., a junior mining company, engages in the acquisition, exploitation, exploration, evaluation, and development of mineral properties in North America. It primarily explores for lithium, zinc, lead, gold, silver, and copper deposits. The company's flagship property is the Cabin Gold project, a gold-in-iron formation property covering an area of approximately 1,503 hectares located in the Northwest Territories; and Slemon Gold and Camp Gold projects located near northwest of Yellowknife. It also holds interests in the Let's Go Lithium project located near Pahrump, Nevada; and the Indian Mountain Lake Volcanic Massive Sulphide project located near Yellowknife, Northwest Territories in Canada. The company was formerly known as Rover Metals Corp. and changed its name to Rover Critical Minerals Corp. in February 2024. Rover Critical Minerals Corp. was incorporated in 2010 and is headquartered in Vancouver, Canada.
